analyzed: bzod par byed cing dbu mar gnas las mnyam med phun tshogs reg par byed //

original: sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud le'u bcu bzhi'i bdag nyid can 'di'i ston pa po dang brjod bya ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas thod pa'o //

original: de lta na yang bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i 'brel ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i 'brel ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa brjod do //

analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis sangs rgyas thod pa'i don rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //

original: rdo rje lta bu bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par byed pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //

original: de la 'di skad bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa nas gyur to zhes pa'i @167a * //
analyzed: de la 'di skad bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa nas gyur to zhes pa'i @167a * //
translated: Regarding that, thus have I heard and so on up to it came to be

original: mthar thug pa'i dang por gleng gzhi ste /

original: 'di yod pa na stong pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yod pa na stong pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

original: dus dang yul dang ston pa po dang 'khor rnams tshogs pa ni ston pa'i gleng gzhi ste /

analyzed: de la 'di skad bdag gis zhes pas de'i chos bsdu bar bya zhing /

original: de bzhin du go rims su rtogs par byas nas zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du go rims su rtogs par byas nas zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sdud pa pos de kho na bzhin du bsdus so //

original: 'dir sdud pa po su yin /
analyzed: 'dir sdud pa po su yin /

original: med das par 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: med das par 'di ci zhe na /

translated: Here, it is the speech of the Lord alone, because it is spoken by him alone, who is authorized by the Lord.

original: yang 'di la rgyud gtad pa nyid kyi phyir phyag na rdo rje'o zhes gsungs so //üîΩde la bsdu bar bya ba phyin ci ma log pa rgyud kyi don mtha' dag 'di skad ces pa'i tshig phrad 'dis gsal bar byad do //
analyzed: yang 'di la rgyud gtad pa nyid kyi phyir phyag na rdo rje'o zhes gsungs so // de la bsdu bar bya ba phyin ci ma log pa rgyud kyi don mtha' dag 'di skad ces pa'i tshig phrad 'dis gsal bar byad do //
translated: Moreover, it is said that it is Vajrapani, because he alone is entrusted with the tantra.üîΩThere, the compiler clarifies the entire meaning of the tantra, which is the unerring object of compilation, with the words ‚Äúthus have I heard.‚Äù

original: de nas 'di skad kyi yi ge 'di ni rgyud kyi don mtha' dag gi don dang ldan pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di skad kyi yi ge 'di ni rgyud kyi don mtha' dag gi don dang ldan pa rtogs par bya'o //

original: rgyud kyi don yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yi ge gnyis kyi yan lag gi ngo bo gnas so zhes 'doms so //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yi ge gnyis kyi yan lag gi ngo bo gnas so zhes 'doms so //

analyzed: de ltar spyir bstan nas khyad par du gleng gzhi de rim gyis ston pa /

original: dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: gcig ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs du mas bskrun pa tshes dang rgyu skar la sogs pas gcad du med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig go //

analyzed: 'di la bha ga yod do @167b zhes pa bcom ldan 'das te /

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /

analyzed: yang na chos thams cad nges par rtog pa nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pa nges par sel ba'i shes rab ni bcom pa ste /

analyzed: de 'di la de'i bdag nyid du yod do zhes pas bcom ldan no //

analyzed: shes rab gzhom bya nyon mongs te //

analyzed: de phyir shes rab bcom par brjod //

translated: The tathƒÅgatas are Ak·π£hobhya and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //

analyzed: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid do //

original: de'i ngo bo chen po ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dag aa lam ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo chen po ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dag aa lam ste /

analyzed: shin tu bla na med par byed pa ste bya ba dang bya ba las gang gi yin pa de rgyan chen po ste /

original: rdo rje snyems ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje snyems ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do //

original: de'i dkyil snying po byang chub kyi sems len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor ni chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i dkyil snying po byang chub kyi sems len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor ni chos 'byung ngo //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyang de yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyang de yin la /
translated: That is the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas,

analyzed: rdo rje rgyan chen po'i dkyil 'khor yang yin pa'o //
translated: and it is also the ma·πá·∏çala of the great vajra ornament.

analyzed: 'di'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that is also the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas, it is of one taste with that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang gru gsum ste de'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang gru gsum ste de'i dbus su'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is also a triangle, and in the middle of that.

original: 'dir gzhal yas khang ma gsungs pa nyid na yang chos 'byung gi dbus na gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang du zhes don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhal yas khang ma gsungs pa nyid na yang chos 'byung gi dbus na gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang du zhes don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, even though the celestial mansion is not mentioned, it should be understood by implication that it is the celestial mansion situated in the middle of the source of phenomena.

original: dper na grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes pa grong khyer na gnas pa'i khang bzang na zhes don gyis 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes pa grong khyer na gnas pa'i khang bzang na zhes don gyis 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúThe rich man lives in the city,‚Äù it is understood that he lives in a fine house in the city.

analyzed: de ltar ma gsungs pa ni bde ba chen po'i sa gzhi gtso bor nye bar bstan pa'i don du @168a * //
translated: The reason it is not mentioned in this way is for the purpose of primarily teaching the ground of great bliss.

original: ste ; gzhal yas khang yang de dang ro gcig pa kho nas so //
analyzed: ste ; gzhal yas khang yang de dang ro gcig pa kho nas so //
translated: and the celestial mansion is of the same taste as that.

original: yang na rdo rje ni stong pa nyid chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni stong pa nyid chos 'byung ste /

original: der rgyan chen po'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhal yas khang de'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: der rgyan chen po'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhal yas khang de'i dbus su'o //
translated: in that, the great ornament mandala is the celestial mansion in the center of that.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i gnas su bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par nye bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku gsal bar rig par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i gnas su bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par nye bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku gsal bar rig par byas la /

original: sku de kho nas rgyud ston pa yang de dang ro gcig par bstan to //
analyzed: sku de kho nas rgyud ston pa yang de dang ro gcig par bstan to //
translated: And by that very body, the teaching of the tantra is also taught to be of the same taste as that.

original: de ltar dus dang yul dang ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar dus dang yul dang ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the perfection of time, place, and teacher,

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: the perfection of the retinue is stated:

original: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúall‚Äù and so forth.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / sna tshogs sde ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma rnams dang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa rnams dang yang bzhugs so //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba bzung ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa pa rnams kyang rdo rje theg pa kho nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub po zhes shes
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / sna tshogs sde ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma rnams dang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa rnams dang yang bzhugs so // 'dod chags dang bral ba bzung ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa pa rnams kyang rdo rje theg pa kho nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub po zhes shes
translated: The Tathagatas Akshobhya and so forth, the yoginis such as Chunda and so forth, and the noble Ananda and so forth, also reside there.

original: pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: pa'i don du'o //
translated: The statement that they are free from desire is just an illustration of those of the Hearer Vehicle, but one should understand that those of the Perfection Vehicle also attain the enlightenment which is the nature of great bliss only by the Vajra Vehicle.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams kyang der 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams kyang der 'dus par gyur to //
translated: The Lord of the World and so forth also gathered there.

original: gleng gzhi'i ngag 'di yang ji ltar srid pa ltar kho bos rgyas pa dang bcas par dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgya cher 'grel du bshad zin pas blo bzang rnams kyis nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i ngag 'di yang ji ltar srid pa ltar kho bos rgyas pa dang bcas par dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgya cher 'grel du bshad zin pas blo bzang rnams kyis nges par bya'o //
translated: This introduction, moreover, is to be understood by the wise from my detailed explanation in the ShriparamƒÅdya commentary, which is as extensive as possible.

original: gleng gzhi dang rjes su mthun par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa sdud pa pos de nas zhes pa la sogs pas skabs byed do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang rjes su mthun par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa sdud pa pos de nas zhes pa la sogs pas skabs byed do //
translated: In accordance with the nidana, the Lord, the compiler of the teaching, makes the occasion with ‚ÄúThen, etc.‚Äù

original: rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i ye shes lnga rnams 'dzin no zhes pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i ye shes lnga rnams 'dzin no zhes pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds the vajra, the five intuitions which are the essence of emptiness, thus he is Vajradhara, the nature of the innate great bliss, the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: phyag rgya chen po bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa 'gro ba la phan pa byed pa stong pa nyid de kho na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa 'gro ba la phan pa byed pa stong pa nyid de kho na rdo rje ste /
translated: The great seal, one taste with great bliss, the activity of benefiting migrating beings, is the vajra of just that emptiness,

original: sgrib pa thams cad 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it splits all obscurations.

original: gnas kyang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas kyang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: It is the abode, the basis of the perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals.

original: de kho na sngags dang rgyud rnams kyi tshad mas 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir mchog tu nye @168b bar bstan pa nyid kyis ni legs par bstan to //
analyzed: de kho na sngags dang rgyud rnams kyi tshad mas 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir mchog tu nye @168b bar bstan pa nyid kyis ni legs par bstan to //
translated: That is taught well, because it is the best, by the validity of the mantras and tantras themselves.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag pos zhes pa bdag po ste /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag pos zhes pa bdag po ste /
translated: Therefore, of all the Tathagatas, that is, Vairochana and so forth, the Lord is the teacher, the unsurpassed one.

original: bdag po nyid kyis ni 'di ston pa po bla na med pa'o zhes gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag po nyid kyis ni 'di ston pa po bla na med pa'o zhes gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is made clear by the word ‚ÄúLord.‚Äù

original: rdo rje ni bdag nyid kyi ste padma ni sna tshogs sde ma'i'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni bdag nyid kyi ste padma ni sna tshogs sde ma'i'o //
translated: The vajra is his own, and the lotus is that of the various goddesses.

original: de dag yang dag par sbyor bas so //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par sbyor bas so //
translated: They are united.

original: btsun mo ni sna tshogs sde ma ste /
analyzed: btsun mo ni sna tshogs sde ma ste /
translated: The queen is the various goddesses.

original: de'i bha ga ni chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i bha ga ni chos 'byung ngo //
translated: Her bhaga is the source of phenomena.

original: nang du ni rdo rje byang chub kyi sems dang / padma spyi bo la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: nang du ni rdo rje byang chub kyi sems dang / padma spyi bo la sogs pa rnams te /

original: de rnams kho na btsun mo'i ste /
analyzed: de rnams kho na btsun mo'i ste /

original: aa ba dh'u t'i'i bha ga rnams so //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i'i bha ga rnams so //

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste byang chub sems kyi ngo bo zhu bar gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste byang chub sems kyi ngo bo zhu bar gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nirvana is the melting of the essence of the bodhicitta.

original: don dam par ni btsun mo ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni btsun mo ni shes rab ste /

original: sna tshogs sde ma ming gzhan kun du bzang mo'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs sde ma ming gzhan kun du bzang mo'o //

original: de'i bha ga ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bha ga ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: His bhaga is emptiness.

original: mang po'i tshig ni sna tshogs sde ma ni btsun mo thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni sna tshogs sde ma ni btsun mo thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is because the various clans are the essence of the collection of all queens.

original: der bcom ldan 'das phyag rgya chen po rdo rje'i gnas kyi shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas shing snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i zhes pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das phyag rgya chen po rdo rje'i gnas kyi shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas shing snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i zhes pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, having passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa in the abode of the great seal, with the wisdom that does not abide in existence and with compassion that does not abide in peace, that is, with the nirvƒÅ·πáa that does not abide,

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur nas ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad mtha' dag gis ma reg pa las 'khor ba'i bar du dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rnal 'byor ma dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur nas ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad mtha' dag gis ma reg pa las 'khor ba'i bar du dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rnal 'byor ma dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: having become of that nature, and with the nature of being of one taste, without being touched by all differences, from the immeasurable tathƒÅgatas, bodhisattvas, yoginƒ´s, and arhats up to the present,

original: phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags bye ba phrag brgyad cu po rnams dang lhan cig rnam par rtog pa med par gyur kyang sngon gyi 'phan pa'i dbang las sems can thams cad la ci bya ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags bye ba phrag brgyad cu po rnams dang lhan cig rnam par rtog pa med par gyur kyang sngon gyi 'phan pa'i dbang las sems can thams cad la ci bya ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: together with the eighty-four thousand mudras, mandalas, and mantras, without conceptualization, but by the power of former prayers, he remains for the sake of all sentient beings in whatever way is necessary.

original: de ltar na yang mchog tu zab pa'i chos 'di bdag gis rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang mchog tu zab pa'i chos 'di bdag gis rtogs kyi /
translated: Thus, although I have realized this most profound Dharma,

original: sems can rnams kyang phal cher bsod nams zhan pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang phal cher bsod nams zhan pa /
translated: sentient beings are mostly of little merit,

original: shes rab ngan pa theg pa dman pa la mos pa rnams te /
analyzed: shes rab ngan pa theg pa dman pa la mos pa rnams te /
translated: of poor intellect, and devoted to the Lesser Vehicle.üîΩTherefore, who will believe in this?

original: des na su zhig 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes gdul bya rnon po rnams gus pas rings pa'i don du mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: des na su zhig 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes gdul bya rnon po rnams gus pas rings pa'i don du mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: In order to inspire respect in the sharpest of disciples, he passes into nirvana,

original: khong du chud pa'i chos ston pa la bya ba med cing mi @169a * //
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i chos ston pa la bya ba med cing mi @169a * //
translated: and does not teach the Dharma that he has realized, because he is not interested in doing so.

original: spro ba'i zhes pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: spro ba'i zhes pa'i don ston to //

original: de zhes pa srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa dang mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa dang mi spro ba'o //
translated: He does not remain in or pass into nirvana.

original: mchog tu brtse ba dang shes rab dang ldan pas ci bya ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa ji ltar mi spro zhes rmad du gyur pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu brtse ba dang shes rab dang ldan pas ci bya ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa ji ltar mi spro zhes rmad du gyur pa thob pa'o //
translated: How could he not be delighted, being supremely compassionate and endowed with wisdom, by the way of what is to be done? Thus, he attained wonder.

original: sna tshogs sde ma la zhes pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs sde ma la zhes pa /
translated: The various army is

original: sna tshogs te rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang rmad du byung ba'i sde ste bde ba chen po gang gi yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs te rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang rmad du byung ba'i sde ste bde ba chen po gang gi yin pa de la'o //
translated: the various, the various kinds, and the army, the great bliss, of which it is.

original: rnal 'byor ma zhes pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhes pa /
translated: The yoginƒ´ is

original: shes rab thabs dang snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: the union of wisdom and means,

original: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
translated: which is expressed as yoga.

original: de 'di la shin tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la shin tu yod pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir dris pa lan gdab pa la nus pa'o zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dris pa lan gdab pa la nus pa'o zhes 'dri'o //
translated: For that very reason, he asks, Are you able to answer the question?

original: gang gis sems can rnams nus pa rang dang gzhan la phan pa rdzogs par byed phod pa 'thob pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig yod dam /
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams nus pa rang dang gzhan la phan pa rdzogs par byed phod pa 'thob pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig yod dam /
translated: Is there some means by which sentient beings can attain the ability to perfect the benefit of self and other?

original: rgyud la sogs pa rnams su sngags kyi thabs bstan pa la dgos pa 'di ga las shen gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud la sogs pa rnams su sngags kyi thabs bstan pa la dgos pa 'di ga las shen gsungs pa ste /
translated: The purpose of teaching the method of mantra in the tantras and so on is stated:

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: Here, the condensed meaning is as follows:

original: gang rgyud la sogs pa thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gsungs pa de rnams la /
analyzed: gang rgyud la sogs pa thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gsungs pa de rnams la /

analyzed: sngags med na nus pa ma mthong zhing /

original: sngags la ni dgos pa mang po rnams skye ste /
analyzed: sngags la ni dgos pa mang po rnams skye ste /

original: de ltar ni chung du dang 'bring dang che ba'i bsod nams can gyi sems can rnams kyi rim pa ji lta bar byed pa dang / 'bum dang / khri bzlas pa rnams kyis 'grub par rdo rje can chen pos gsungs na /
analyzed: de ltar ni chung du dang 'bring dang che ba'i bsod nams can gyi sems can rnams kyi rim pa ji lta bar byed pa dang / 'bum dang / khri bzlas pa rnams kyis 'grub par rdo rje can chen pos gsungs na /
translated: Thus, the great Vajra Holder has taught that the small, medium, and great beings with merit accomplish [their goals] by reciting [the mantra] a hundred thousand, ten thousand, and one hundred times, respectively.

original: nga yang ci chung ngu la sogs pa'i nang du rtogs sam ma yin zhes the tshom dang ldan pa ni sems zhen pas ji ltar sngags zlos /
analyzed: nga yang ci chung ngu la sogs pa'i nang du rtogs sam ma yin zhes the tshom dang ldan pa ni sems zhen pas ji ltar sngags zlos /
translated: If even I have doubts about whether I will attain the small and so forth, how can the mind be attached to reciting the mantra?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bcom pa log pa'i shes pa can rnams ji ltar 'dod chags la zhugs pa de las sngags zlos /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bcom pa log pa'i shes pa can rnams ji ltar 'dod chags la zhugs pa de las sngags zlos /
translated: Those with perverted knowledge, overcome by attachment and so forth, should recite the mantra while engaged in attachment.

original: 'dod chags la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams zhes glog pa la ni de rnams kyi zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams zhes glog pa la ni de rnams kyi zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: Those beings who are engaged in attachment should be considered as those of them by the wise.

original: mi shes pa rnams kyi rgyud dang sngags zlos pa la rtsis bgrang ba srid kyang ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yin /
analyzed: mi shes pa rnams kyi rgyud dang sngags zlos pa la rtsis bgrang ba srid kyang ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yin /
translated: It is possible to count the recitations of mantras in the mindstreams of the ignorant, but how can they be done with an afflicted mind?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa can gyi yang shin tu ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa can gyi yang shin tu ste /
translated: They are also done with a mind of perfect knowledge.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mthar sems dmigs pa ni gang gis nges par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mthar sems dmigs pa ni gang gis nges par brtags pa ste /
translated: The mind that observes the extremes of existence and nonexistence is ascertained by the mind that is free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: nishtha'i mtha' can @169b ni 'ga' zhig tu pha rol tshig phrad do //
analyzed: nishtha'i mtha' can @169b ni 'ga' zhig tu pha rol tshig phrad do //
translated: The suffix ni·π£·π≠ha is sometimes used as a locative case particle.

original: de'i sngags ni ji ltar sngags te sngags su bya ba bzlas bya yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni ji ltar sngags te sngags su bya ba bzlas bya yin te /
translated: How can that mantra be a mantra? It is a mantra that is recited.

original: sems rtogs pa de las yid kyi ngo bo yid dang / skyob pa'i ngo bo skyob pa ste stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa don dam pa'i sngags yin cing de kho na las rang dang gzhan gyi don nus pa'i dngos grub yin na sngags bzlas pas ci zhig ces pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtogs pa de las yid kyi ngo bo yid dang / skyob pa'i ngo bo skyob pa ste stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa don dam pa'i sngags yin cing de kho na las rang dang gzhan gyi don nus pa'i dngos grub yin na sngags bzlas pas ci zhig ces pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The essence of the mind is the mind, and the essence of the protector is the protector, which is the indivisible emptiness and compassion, the ultimate mantra. If that is the siddhi that has the power to accomplish one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals, what is the use of reciting mantras?

original: thams cad du ji ltar zhes pa dri ba la'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ji ltar zhes pa dri ba la'o //
translated: In all cases, how is it?

original: de ltar zhes pa brjod pa'i rim pas rtog dpyod dang ldan pas mi bzlas te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa brjod pa'i rim pas rtog dpyod dang ldan pas mi bzlas te /
translated: Thus is the sequence of expression. One should not repeat with conceptualüîΩreflection.

original: de la yang zlos pa yod na yang dngos grub gzhan du dngos grub ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang zlos pa yod na yang dngos grub gzhan du dngos grub ma yin pa'o //
translated: If there is repetition there, then there is no power elsewhere.

original: bskal pa skar ma lta bu bye ba zhes pa gsum pa'i don la dang po'o //
analyzed: bskal pa skar ma lta bu bye ba zhes pa gsum pa'i don la dang po'o //
translated: The meaning of in millions of eons like stars is the first.

original: nam mkha' la skar ma dpag tu med pa bzhin du dpag tu med pa'i bskal pa bye bas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la skar ma dpag tu med pa bzhin du dpag tu med pa'i bskal pa bye bas so //
translated: In millions of eons, which are like the countless stars in the sky.üîΩThus, just as repetition is impossible in the way that is necessary, so too

original: de ltar zhes pa ji ltar dgos pa la bzlas pa mi srid pa de ltar don la the tshom za ba la sogs pas res 'ga' bzlas pa yod pa yang dngos grub kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ji ltar dgos pa la bzlas pa mi srid pa de ltar don la the tshom za ba la sogs pas res 'ga' bzlas pa yod pa yang dngos grub kyang ngo //
translated: there is repetition sometimes in doubt about the meaning, etc., and there isüîΩpower.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the Blessed Lord.

original: lha mo chen mo ni btsun mo mchog go //
analyzed: lha mo chen mo ni btsun mo mchog go //
translated: The great goddess is the supreme queen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das bzhin du rgyud thams cad kyi bdag mo ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das bzhin du rgyud thams cad kyi bdag mo ste /
translated: For that very reason, like the Blessed Lord, she is the mistress of all tantras,

original: rgyud thams cad ston par rung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad ston par rung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because all tantras are suitable to be taught.

original: de ltar ni 'dis rdo rje phag mo'i gzugs kyis 'bum pa mngon par brjod pa dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rgyud dag bstan //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dis rdo rje phag mo'i gzugs kyis 'bum pa mngon par brjod pa dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rgyud dag bstan //
translated: Thus, by this [verse], the hundred-thousand [verse] commentary of Vajravarahi and the Vajradaka Tantra are taught.

original: zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das kho na 'di'o zhes pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na 'di'o zhes pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One himself is this, which is the purpose.

original: dbang phyug ma ni thams cad du thogs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma ni thams cad du thogs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The goddess is everywhere unobstructed and endowed with inconceivable power.

original: gzigs pa tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: gzigs pa tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das //
translated: By merely seeing the Blessed One,

original: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
translated: this is the Blessed One's.

original: thod par zhes pa thod pa las te /
analyzed: thod par zhes pa thod pa las te /
translated: In the skull-cup, from the skull-cup,

original: kam bde ba skyong bar byed ces pa ka p'a la byang chub kyi sa bon gzhom du med pa'o //
analyzed: kam bde ba skyong bar byed ces pa ka p'a la byang chub kyi sa bon gzhom du med pa'o //
translated: kam means to protect bliss, kapala means the indestructible seed of enlightenment.

original: de las sngags phyung ngo //
analyzed: de las sngags phyung ngo //
translated: From that, the mantra is uttered.

original: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa ste smin ma'i dbus su ye shes kyi sa bon thig le'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa ste smin ma'i dbus su ye shes kyi sa bon thig le'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the intention here: the seed of wisdom should be meditated on in the middle of the eyebrows in the form of a drop, it is said.

original: smin ma'i dbus su thig le'i rnam par sems sgom pas brtan par byas nas sngags spro bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus su thig le'i rnam par sems sgom pas brtan par byas nas sngags spro bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having stabilized the mind in the form of a drop in the middle of the brow, one should emit the mantra.

original: yang na @170a * //
analyzed: yang na @170a * //
translated: Or else,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel ba'i thod pa las te sna tshogs sde ma'i chos 'byung las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel ba'i thod pa las te sna tshogs sde ma'i chos 'byung las so //
translated: from the skull connected with the Bhagavat, that is, from the dharmodaya of Visvamata.

original: gang gsungs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gsungs par 'gyur ba /
translated: What is said there

original: de'i thod par dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang rgyud legs par rnam par gnas so zhes 'di ni 'dir man ngag ste /
analyzed: de'i thod par dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang rgyud legs par rnam par gnas so zhes 'di ni 'dir man ngag ste /
translated: is that the mandala, the mantra, and the tantra are well-established in the skull. This is the instruction here.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i gnas gzhom du med pa las 'ongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i gnas gzhom du med pa las 'ongs te /
translated: The mantra comes from the abode of the Bhagavat's great bliss cakra, which is invincible.

original: 'og gi lam nas byung nas bcom ldan 'das ma'i chos 'byung du zhugs te /
analyzed: 'og gi lam nas byung nas bcom ldan 'das ma'i chos 'byung du zhugs te /

analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
